data.event: The county was established on April 30, 1803, less than two months after Ohio became a state, and was named after Benjamin Franklin.

event.title: less than two months after Ohio became

data.event: The county was established on April 30, 1803, less than two months after Ohio became a state, and was named after Benjamin Franklin.
On March 30, 1803, the Ohio government authorized the creation of Franklin County.
In 1816, Franklin County’s Columbus became Ohio’s state capital.
Surveyors laid out the city in 1812, and officials incorporated it in 1816.
